intro: Vaccinium alvarezii, commonly known as the Alvarez huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many other ericaceous plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and produces berries that are typically dark blue or black in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
